alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 5:40PM CDT until July 17 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTY... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms producing heavy rain are moving out of the warned area. However, radar estimates between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in the Midway and Latana communities of southwest Cumberland County. Any flood waters will take some time to recede. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Midway, Lantana, southern Crossville, Crab Orchard, Lake Tansi, Cumberland Mountain State Park and Indian Rock Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
